content: Good morning Rohan ☀️ Neel suggested we kick off the week with the keynote debrief today. Shall I lock in a 30-min slot with the team around 6pm SGT?
Morning Ruby. 6pm works, I’ll be back from client meetings by then. Let’s confirm 👍
Rohan, great to have you on. Congrats again on the keynote—your execution validated a lot of the prep work. Today we’re codifying this into your personal Peak Performance Playbook.
Thanks Neel. Felt the best I have in months. Curious to see how the team interprets the data.
From your HRV and sleep data: HRV climbed steadily 48h pre-keynote, sleep efficiency was 90%. The biofeedback drills clearly buffered stress response. Strong evidence the prep was effective.
Nutrition side: targeted electrolytes + ketogenic base stabilized energy. You avoided the typical post-speech crash we often see. That stability is now repeatable.
Exactly. We’ll lock this into your Playbook so future high-stakes events have a proven protocol. You now have a blueprint.
Makes sense. Appreciate the synthesis 🙏 Let’s definitely codify this for future use.
Morning! Advik and Carla will send through first results from the carb re-intro experiment later today. Shall I ask them to share around lunchtime?
Yes, please. Would like to glance at it before my afternoon board prep.

Here’s a quick chart 📈: after quinoa, glucose rose modestly but returned to baseline within 60 minutes. Compared to pre-keto phase, that’s ~30% faster clearance. Strong sign your metabolic flexibility improved.
Exactly. It means your body’s handling carbs without major spikes or crashes. We’ll continue with oats and fruit later this week to broaden the test.
That’s encouraging. Definitely felt less foggy after the quinoa meal. Let’s proceed with oats next.

Rohan, building on the keynote success: you managed both physiology and psychology. I recommend establishing a formal mental health baseline. It’ll quantify mood, stress resilience, and provide a foundation for sustainable performance.
Interesting. Is the idea that stronger mental health baseline gives me buffer against POTS/long COVID flare-ups under stress—similar to how physical training built resilience?
Exactly. Psychological resilience strengthens autonomic stability. By quantifying stress capacity, we can create targeted strategies—just like we did for physical stress.
Makes sense. Let’s set it up.
Understood ✅ I’ll identify a clinical psychologist specializing in executive performance and coordinate with Sarah for scheduling.

Morning Rohan! Now that the keynote’s behind you, I’d like to introduce a Metabolic Flexibility Workout this week: a fasted Zone 2 cardio session (30 mins). It trains fat utilization. Can we aim for Thu morning?
Thu AM works. I’ll be home, so treadmill is available. Let’s plan for 7am.
Perfect. I’ll send you pacing guidelines tomorrow so you’re ready.
Quick update: I’ve shortlisted two psychologists with executive health expertise. I’ll share profiles with you and Sarah tomorrow morning for your review.
Here are the two psychologists I mentioned. Both are experienced with execs in high-stress roles. Shared details with Sarah as well—she’ll advise on scheduling preference.
Got it, thanks Ruby. Will leave it with Sarah to finalize.
Rohan, keto debrief ready for tomorrow. Data shows 22% improvement in subjective focus scores, HRV up 15%, and work output markers aligned. Validates your hypothesis strongly.
That’s excellent. Glad the subjective matched the data. Looking forward to closing the loop.
Morning! Reminder: today’s fasted Zone 2 cardio. Aim for HR 120–130 bpm, steady pace, 30 mins. Water only before. Report how you feel after.
Done ✅ Managed 28 mins, HR averaged 126. Felt steady, not drained. Bit hungry afterwards.
Perfect execution. Hunger is expected—refuel with balanced carbs + protein breakfast. Great first step in training metabolic flexibility.
Thanks for joining the keto debrief earlier today. Advik’s full report is saved in your dashboard. Shall I also prep a one-page summary for quick reference?
Yes please. The summary would be handy to revisit before travel.
This morning’s carb test: oats + berries. Note any cognitive changes and energy levels mid-morning, then share with me?
Noticed mild dip in focus around 10:30am, but nothing drastic. Energy still fine. Logged in notes.
Great. That minor dip is expected—we’ll see if it repeats with other carbs. Your recovery is the bigger signal, which looks positive.
One-pager keto summary ready and shared to your dashboard. Also emailed Sarah for archiving.
Perfect. Appreciate the quick turnaround 🙏
This week’s glucose data: oats recovery curve similar to quinoa—baseline within 65 mins. Confirms consistency in improved flexibility.
Good to see it’s holding. Feels sustainable.
Wrapping the week: keynote Playbook documented ✅, keto experiment officially closed, carb re-intro on track, psychologist shortlisting underway. Anything else you’d like us to prioritize next week?
That covers it. Solid progress this week. Thanks all 🙌
